result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrea R Vidales-Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Counseling deemed necessary.
DNA sample must be provided within 30 days.
PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY WOOD COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.

timeConds.notes:
2 days of credit.
Huber privileges pursuant to 303.08.
Consecutive to: to sentence currently being served.

2:07 PM Defendant Andrea R Vidales-Perez appeared by video, in custody.  Defendant questing why she does not have good time.  Court has no reason to have good time taken away and has the jail look into if they have a reason for good time being taken away.
Hearing on no contact order on September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
DNA Proof of Submission

2:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter C Lloyd c in court for Andrea R Vidales-Perez. Defendant Andrea R Vidales-Perez appeared by video, in custody. 
Court informs defendant he has approved a furlough that was requested. Attorney Oswald gives the court his sentencing recommendation. Attorney Lloyd gives a statement regarding sentencing. Defendant makes a statement regarding sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 28, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Final pre-trial on June 27, 2022 at 11:15 am.

11:36 AM Prosecuting attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrea R Vidales-Perez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Peter C Lloyd c appeared by video for Andrea R Vidales-Perez. 
Attorney Lloyd would like to reschedule this for about a week out to finalize the case. Court grants. Attorney Lloyd needs to contact Br. 2 and get a new date.
Bond is continued.

2:10 PM  Defendant Andrea R Vidales-Perez in court.  Attorney Peter C Lloyd c appeared by phone for Andrea R Vidales-Perez.  Attorney Daniel McGrath in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Not guilty pleas are entered.
Final pre-trial scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Public defender order appointing counsel

1:56 PM Defendant Andrea R Vidales-Perez in court.  Attorney Daniel McGrath in court for State of Wisconsin. Officer Khang is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being employed as an Officer with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. Testifies to conducting a traffic stop where the vehicle owner had a suspended license. Testifies to the vehicle initially not stopping. Testifies to the driver making furtive movements. Testifies to the driver and the passenger being the defendant. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. Testifies to conducting a record check that showed both parties being on probation. Testifies to an ACT 79 search being conducted. Testifies to the substances and paraphernalia that was found. Testifies to the substances being tested and the results. Testifies to where the substances were found. 
Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. 
This matter will be set for an arraignment hearing. Bond is continued.

NOH mailed to defendant with address listed on Bail/Bond paperwork
8424 Pine Street, Bancroft, WI 54921

No controlled substances without a valid prescription. $2500.
